source: English Phrasal Verbs in Use Advanced

phrasal_verbs.definition: formal to agree to something that someone has asked for [e.g. request, demand], often after disagreeing with it
to explain the reason for something or the cause of something
to be a reasonable or likely explanation for something
to have a particular result or effect
formal to believe or say that something is caused by something else
to ask several people in order to try to get information or help
to invite someone to come with you to a place such as the cinema or a restaurant, especially as a way of starting a romantic relationship
to connect someone or something in your mind with someone or something else
to deal with a situation or problem
slightly formal to believe or say that something is the result of something else
to stop being involved in a situation, especially in order to allow other people to deal with it themselves
to make a copy of computer information so that you do not lose it
to help a person or organisation by giving them money
to move around a place, making a lot of noise
if you base something on particular facts or ideas, you use those facts or ideas to develop that thing
informal to behave stupidly in a way that is likely to cause problems for you
if you say something is floating around, you mean that you have seen it somewhere but you do not know exactly where it is
when time is getting on, it is getting late
to be watching something [esp. television] with all your attention
to use a lot of time and effort with no results
to try to harm someone or cause trouble for them
formal to be directly connected to something
to stop yourself from thinking about something unpleasant because it upsets you
to make something seem much worse or much better than it really is
to move in an awkward way, usually because you cannot see where you are going
if a situation or problem boils down to a particular thing, that is the main reason for it
to tell people what they should do all the time
if a situation, level, or rate that is getting worse bottoms out, it reaches the lowest point and remains at that level or amount, usually before improving
to prevent someone from doing what they want to do
if a road or path branches off, it goes in another direction
if a machine or vehicle breaks down, it stops working
if an event breaks up a period of time, it makes it more interesting by being different to what you are doing for the rest of the time
to change the date or time of an event so that it happens earlier than planned
to earn or make a particular amount of money
to start to behave better
to admit that you are wrong
to act in a silly way
to discover something by chance, or to meet someone by chance
to start to exist, happen, or be available
if something comes back to you, you remember it
to be a result of a process or event
to happen soon
to make something appear in someone’s mind
to deal with a difficult situation
to be one of the causes of an event
to deal successfully with a problem
to stop people from entering an area
if you say that you couldn’t ask for someone or something better, you mean that that person or thing is the best of their kind
to expect something to happen
to not include someone in an activity
to surround something closely
to suddenly shout something loudly
to interrupt someone speaking
to stop the supply of something
to be unable to communicate from another area
to leave a place quickly
to need the help or support of something or someone in order to survive or continue as before
to take something important away from someone
if something, especially a sound, dies away, it gradually becomes less strong or clear and then stops
to refuse to do what others try to persuade you to do
to start doing something suddenly without thinking about it
to continue for longer than is necessary, or to make something do this
to make somebody stop doing something, so that they can do something else
to talk about or bring someone or something into a difficult or unpleasant situation, especially when that person or thing is seen as being connected with the situation
to make something continue for longer than is usual or necessary
to look at, listen to, or experience something with all your attention and to enjoy it very much
to leave in a vehicle
to talk for a long time in a very boring way
to fall asleep
to not do something that you were going to do, or to stop doing something
if a supply of something dries up, it ends
to think or talk about a particular subject for too long
to gradually stop or become less
to use or take away a large part of something valuable
to eat all the food you have been given
to use something slowly or carefully because you only have a small supply of it
to accept that a difficult or unpleasant situation exists
to include something when making a calculation or when trying to understand something
if an organisation, system, or agreement falls apart, it fails or stops working effectively
if a plan or agreement fails to happen
to use violence so that something or someone goes away
to make someone so tired, weak, or unhappy that they are unable to continue what they were doing
to eat or drink all of what you are eating or drinking

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: fish out sth or fish sth out
phrasal_verbs.definition: to pull or take something out of a bag or pocket, especially after searching
to be able to be done between other activities
if one activity or event fits in with another, they exist or happen together in a way which is convenient
if someone flares up, they suddenly become very angry
if your mind or thoughts flash back to something that happened to you in the past, you suddenly remember that thing
if memories flood back, you suddenly remember very clearly a lot of things about an experience or period in the past
to arrive or enter somewhere in very large numbers or amounts
if rumours fly around, they are made in a way which makes people excited
to attack someone suddenly and violently
if someone flies into a particular state [e.g. rage, temper, panic] they are suddenly in that state
to give a lot of attention to one particular activity, situation or idea

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: free up sth or free sth up
phrasal_verbs.definition: to make time or money available for a particular use by not using it in another way
if water freezes over, it becomes covered with ice

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: fritter away sth or fritter sth away
phrasal_verbs.definition: to waste something [esp. money, time] by using it in a careless way for unimportant things
to believe that something is wrong and that you should not do it
to form a group to act against someone else
if news or information gets around, a lot of people hear about it
to have or know just enough of something to be able to deal with a particular situation but not have or know as much as you would like

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: get off on the wrong foot
phrasal_verbs.definition: to start something badly
to like someone, and enjoy spending time with them

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: get on like a house on fire
phrasal_verbs.definition: to immediately like each other
to make someone feel unhappy
to stand up
to organise yourself more efficiently
to avoid discussing something, or to discuss something without talking about the details in order to make it seem unimportant
if a situation goes back to a particular state, it returns to that state
if a computer system goes down, it stops working
to describe, discuss, or examine something in a detailed way
to stop liking someone or something
to continue to exist or happen
if something which is burning goes out, it stops burning
to leave one group or organisation and join a competing group or organisation
using new methods and ideas to succeed
to shoot someone and kill or seriously injure them
to get into someone else's computer system without permission
to spend time with someone
to depend on something
to keep someone or something
to want something very much, especially something you know you should not want
to find something or meet someone without planning to
to talk continually about something in a way that other people find boring or annoying
to spend time away from work
to begin a journey or to leave
to depend on something or be very influenced by it
to have a good idea, especially one that solves a problem
to strongly criticise something or someone
to prevent something from working effectively, or to prevent someone or something from making progress
to limit the freedom of a group of people
to wait until you get what you want and to refuse to accept anything less
to delay something and to arrange to do it at a later time
to make someone do something more quickly, or to make something happen more quickly
to have a noticeable effect on
to make something more attractive or interesting
to continue to be friendly with someone, especially because they can help you
to talk in an annoying way about something for a long time
to start
to remove your shoes by shaking your feet
to force someone to leave a place or an organisation
to cause someone to fall to the ground by pushing or hitting them
to reduce a price, or to persuade someone to reduce the price of something that they are selling
to destroy and remove a building or part of a building [esp. wall]
to make someone become unconscious or to make someone fall asleep
to hit or kick someone several times
to consider an idea
to finally be in a particular place, state, or situation, especially without having planned it
to criticise someone or something in an angry way
to make someone do something bad by encouraging them or annoying them until they do it
if an action or event leads to something, it causes that thing to happen or exist
if a period of time or a series of events leads up to an event or activity, it happens until that event or activity begins
to stop, or to stop doing something
if something lets in water, air, or light, it allows water, air, or light to enter it through a hole or opening
if things are lying around, they are untidily left in places where they should not be
to move something from a lower to a higher position
to continue to exist
to connect a computer to a system of computers by typing your name or password, usually so that you can start working
to take care of someone or something by doing what is needed to keep them well or in good condition
to think that someone is less important than you, or to think that something is not good enough quality for you to use
to try to find something or someone, either because you have lost them or because you need them
to feel pleased and excited about something that is going to happen
to make something disappear so quickly that it seems as if you have used magic
to do something to compensate for not doing it previously
to make a decision about something
to give someone a lower result in an exam or competition because they have made a mistake or done something wrong
if a student moves up, or if a teacher moves them up, they are put in a higher level or class
to do something very badly
to look around a place, often in order to find something
if a country or area opens up, or is opened up, it becomes easier to travel around it or sell things to it
if an event or opportunity passes you by, you do not notice it or you do not get any advantage from it
to make something more interesting or attractive, or to make someone feel more active or energetic
if an energetic activity or a strong emotion peters out, it gradually becomes less energetic or strong until it stops completely
to choose one thing or person or several things or people from a large group
if the wind picks up, it becomes stronger
to start something again from the point where you had stopped
to react to something that you have noticed or something that has happened
to collect someone who is waiting for you, or to collect something that you have left somewhere or that you have bought
to force someone to stay in a horizontal position by holding them
to help with work that needs to be done
to behave in a stupid way
if one thing points to something else, it makes it seem likely that it is true
to study or look carefully at something, especially a book or a document
to spend time in a pleasant, relaxed way, often doing small jobs in or around the house
predisposing someone to something makes it more likely that that thing will happen
to be in charge of an event or situation and have official responsibility for it
to continue doing something in a determined way
to print a particular number of copies of something
to do everything you can
to make an effort to improve
to push someone or something so that they fall to the ground
to tell someone what to do in a rude or threatening way
both sides accept something
to intend to achieve something, or to be intended to achieve something
to intend something to influence someone, or to be noticed or bought by someone
to take something into consideration
to become a particular amount
to achieve an agreement or decision, especially after thinking about it or discussing it for a long time
to have as the average number
to make things equal
to put something down with force, often because you are angry
to talk about a plan or idea and to discuss different ways of dealing with it
to become so involved in the details of something that you cannot achieve anything
to have the right qualities for something
to be based on a particular idea or belief
to be involved with someone who has a bad influence on you
to deal with a very sad or difficult situation in a brave and determined way
informal to work hard at something for a long time, especially something you are writing
informal to sing or to play a musical instrument very loudly
to do something you don’t want to do
to produce a lot of noise, especially loud music
to fill a hole so that nothing can pass through it
to speak in a loud voice, or to make a loud noise
if someone’s eyes bore into you, they look at you very hard and make you feel nervous
to spoil a piece of work by doing it badly
to tell someone about an idea or plan in order to find out what they think of it
to do something you don’t want to do
to become involved in a type of business or activity that is difficult to become involved in
to produce something to sell to the public
to cause people to be friendly with each other, especially people who have argued with each other
to use a brush or your hand to remove something from someone or something
to give an amount of money, especially when a group of people are giving money to pay for something together
if a bird chirps away, it sings continuously
to get rid of something that is not needed anymore
if someone cleans you out, they take or use all the money you have, or if something expensive cleans you out, you spend all the money you have on it
to remove dirt someone has made, or to make a place tidy by putting things back where they belong
to remove things in order to make a place tidy
to do only the things that you have to do without trying to go faster or be more successful
to make something quickly and not very carefully
to agree to a plan or idea that you were against
to think about something in a particular way
to emerge or become visible
to state publicly that you are opposed to an issue
to state publicly that you support an issue
to agree with someone’s idea after thinking about it
to agree on something after discussion
to be formed from two or more things
to begin to understand a situation
to provide money unwillingly
to make someone or something more likely to fail
to include a person in a plan
to be part of what is needed to achieve something
to separate skilled people and treat them differently
to remove a word from a list
to start supporting a different person or group
to buy and sell particular goods
to choose something or someone after thinking carefully
to accept someone else’s opinion because they know more than you or are more important than you
to behave badly in a way that other people would not expect you to
to make something seem less good than it really is or than it was thought to be
to use all of something, for example your life or your time, for a particular purpose
if something, especially noise or excitement, dies down, it gradually becomes less loud or strong until it stops
informal to attack or kill someone
British & Australian to decorate or clean a room
informal to stop someone from getting or keeping something, in a dishonest or unfair way
to wrap something [esp. present] in paper
to manage without something or someone
to make yourself look more attractive
to make someone or something sure to fail or suffer in a particular way
if something designed for one purpose can double up as something else, it can also be used for something else
to use information from somewhere
to help someone who is shy to feel more confident
to put on someone else’s clothes to make yourself look like someone else, or to make someone do this, usually as a game
to completely finish your drink
to take someone or something to a place and leave them there
if a loud noise drowns out another noise, it prevents it from being heard
to increase interest in something or support for something
to encourage someone to do something, often something that is wrong, stupid, or dangerous
to finally be in a situation
to use something when other things have failed
to fail to remain level with a group of people that is moving forwards
if the amount, rate, or quality of something falls off, it becomes smaller or lower
to give work to other people instead of doing it yourself
to stop using or needing

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: firm up sth or firm sth up
phrasal_verbs.definition: to make something more definite or less likely to change

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: fix up sth or fix sth up
phrasal_verbs.definition: to arrange something [esp. meeting]
if the rate of something flattens out, or if something flattens it out, it stops increasing and decreasing and begins to stay at the same level

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: fling off sth or fling sth off
phrasal_verbs.definition: to remove very quickly
to start to spend a lot of your time and energy doing something
to talk and behave towards someone in a way that is sexually attractive and which shows that person that you are sexually attracted to them
to make something [e.g. cloth, paper, chair] into a smaller, neater and usually flatter shape by folding it, or to be able to be folded in this way

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: follow up sth or follow sth up
phrasal_verbs.definition: to find out more about something
to pay too much attention to someone or something, especially because you want to show that you like them

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: gather up sth or gather sth up
phrasal_verbs.definition: to collect several things, especially from different places, and put them together
to design something so that it is suitable for a particular purpose, situation, or group of people
to succeed in an examination or competition, or to help someone or something do this
to begin doing something
to manage to write down a series of spoken points
to succeed in getting a place at a school, college, or organisation
to succeed in getting a place at a school, college, or organisation
to leave the place where you work, usually at the end of the day
something that you say in order to tell someone to stop touching someone or something

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: get the most out of sb/sth
phrasal_verbs.definition: to take maximum benefit from something

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: give up (sth /doing sth) or give (sth) up
phrasal_verbs.definition: to stop doing an activity or piece of work before you have completed it, usually because it is too difficult
slightly informal something that you say to someone to give them permission to start to do something
to agree with someone’s idea or opinion
if someone goes around doing something, they spend their time
to treat someone in a gentle way, especially when you want to be or should be more severe
something that you say to encourage someone to try and achieve something
if a fact or piece of information goes in, you understand it and remember it
to choose a particular type of work as your job
to start to do something after finishing something else
to have a romantic relationship
to have a romantic relationship
to think about something that has happened or something that was said
if a law, plan, or deal goes through, it is officially accepted or approved
if a shout goes up, a lot of people make that noise at the same time
to accept a plan or an idea, or to support the person whose ideas you agree with
to use a lot of something, especially money
to try to deal with or understand a difficult problem or subject
to quickly use or accept an opportunity to do or have something
if something grates on you, it annoys you
if a child grows out of an interest, they stop having or doing it because they have become older
something that you say to an adult in order to tell them to stop behaving stupidly
to reach an agreement after a lot of argument or discussion
to tell your boss officially that you do not want to do your job anymore
something that you say to tell someone to stop doing or saying something
if a problem or threat hangs over a person or situation, it exists and makes people worry about what is going to happen
if you have clothes or shoes on, you are wearing them
to think that someone is a particular type of person, especially when they are not in fact like that
to be in charge of an organisation
to receive news or information from someone, usually by letter or telephone
to put a supply of something in a safe place so that you can use it in the future
to tell someone to stop doing something for a very short while
to tell someone to move more quickly or do a task more quickly
to do something in a better way or with better results than when it was done before
to demand something and to make it clear that you will not accept anything else
to try to persuade someone that they want something
to use a lot of time or effort trying to achieve something or trying to make something successful
to find a way of solving small difficulties or problems, or to find a way of ending a disagreement
to write something down quickly (so that you remember it)
to stick out from a surface or beyond
if you keep the noise of something down, you stop it from becoming too loud
to continue to do something, especially to work hard or to do good work
to be able to understand or deal with something that is happening or changing very fast
to have heard of someone or something and to be able to give some information about them, but not very much
to know the difference between something and something else, so that you can recognise either of them
to start to work or study hard, especially if you have not been working very hard before
to be in a difficult situation, or to cause someone to be in a difficult situation or an unpleasant place [e.g. prison]
to support, or begin to support, a particular set of ideas or a particular political party
if something leaps out at you, you notice it immediately
to make progress much faster than someone else
to make a piece of clothing longer by removing the sewing from the bottom folded edge and then sewing closer to the edge of the material
to talk or act in a way that helps
to make a piece of clothing wider by removing the sewing from the side edges and then sewing closer to the edge of the material
if a rate or amount levels off, it stops rising or falling and it stays at the same level
if your face or eyes light up, or if something [e.g. smile] lights them up, you suddenly look very happy or excited
to move something in order to make it straight or level with something else
to make an effort to hear a noise which you are expecting
to accept a difficult or unpleasant situation and continue with your life while it exists
to lock all the doors and windows of a building when you leave it
to focus on somebody/something
to investigate or find out about something
to be less successful than
if someone makes up for something bad that they have done, they do something good so that the bad thing does not cause a problem anymore
to use a cloth or a mop to remove a liquid that has been dropped or that has spread
to think carefully about something for a long time, often before making a decision
to make a decision about
to not allow something, or not allow someone to do something
to feel or say that you oppose or dislike something or someone
if a thought or idea occurs to you, it comes into your mind
to manage to do a lot of activities in a period of time
to give something away, usually when you do not want to
to not give someone a job or a higher position and give it to someone else who is younger or less experienced
to try to improve your relationship with someone after an argument
to put money into a bank account, often to save money for a particular purpose
to try to understand a situation or to try to discover the truth about something by collecting different pieces of information and considering them at the same time
to become a pile, or to make a lot of things into a pile by putting them on top of each other
if someone plays on your fears or weaknesses, they use them to try and make you do what they want, often in a way that is unfair
to encourage one person or group to compete against or argue with another, hoping that you can get some advantage from this situation
if you play with the idea of doing something, you consider it, but usually do not do it
to put money that you have earned into a business, in order to make the business bigger or better
to work hard at something for a long time
to make something [e.g. cushion, pillow] rounder and softer, especially by shaking it
to highlight
to be proud of a quality you have or of something you do
to get an advantage from something
to make something stay in a particular position by putting something underneath or against it
to succeed in dealing with a difficult period of your life, or to help someone else to do this
to put on clothes quickly
to close a door or window by pulling it towards you
to move a piece of furniture [esp. chair] near to something or someone
to close a door or window by pushing it
to make a plan or suggestion be officially accepted
to increase the amount, number, or value of something
to save money for a particular purpose
to put something in the place where it is usually kept
to change the
if a type of food or drink does not agree with you, it makes you feel slightly ill
to accept or obey an agreement, rule, or decision
formal to obey a rule or principle
if a building backs onto something, its back faces that thing
to prove that something that someone has said or written [e.g. claim, theory] is true, or to say that someone is telling the truth
if the sun beats down, it shines strongly and makes the air very hot
to move the top part of your body towards the ground
if something or someone blends in, they look or seem the same as the things or people around them and so you do not notice them
to put a car or other vehicle so close to another vehicle that it cannot drive away
if smoke or a cloud blots out the sun, it covers it and prevents it from being seen
if a car tyre blows out, it suddenly bursts
to say something suddenly and without thinking, especially because you are excited or nervous
to direct a lot of something at one person
to surprise or please someone a lot
to separate a part from a larger piece
if you break out in a sweat, it suddenly appears on your skin
to look after a child and educate them until they are old enough to look after themselves
to force yourself not to show your feelings
to become silent or to refuse to speak about something, usually because you are shy or afraid
to leave a place
if an illness clears up, or if medicine clears an illness up, the illness goes away
if a price or level comes down, it becomes lower
if someone comes in for criticism or praise, they are criticised or praised for something they have done
to begin to exist or happen, or to begin to be fashionable
to stop using medicine or drugs
if something starts working
to say something suddenly
to suddenly experience a feeling
to manage to get to the end of a difficult situation
to be controlled by a particular authority
to deal with a difficult situation or someone opposing you
to reach an acceptable standard
to tell someone secrets
to stop people from discovering the truth
to move closer to someone without being seen
to lie with back curved and knees close
to make a tree fall by cutting it
to suddenly drive in front of someone
to stop consuming something for health
to take action in order to achieve something, or in order to solve a problem
to become more and more rare and then disappear completely
to take something out of the ground by digging
to quickly put something into something else and then take it out again, especially biscuits in tea or coffee
if a type of food disagrees with you, it makes you feel slightly ill or uncomfortable
if a place is dotted with something, it has many of them, all over the place
to suddenly bend your body forwards because you are laughing a lot or you are in pain
to turn and go back in the direction that you have come from
to make someone tell you something that they do not want to tell you
to move away from someone or something, usually because you are surprised or afraid
to hold up your glass before drinking from it in order to celebrate something or to wish someone success or happiness
if you are moving forward in a group of people and you drop back, you move to a position nearer the back
British & Australian informal to make a short visit to someone in their home, usually without arranging it before
to make something dry, or to become dry
to make something simpler and easier to understand
to gradually destroy something by continuously damaging it or taking little parts of it away
to have a meal at home, not in a restaurant
to gradually cover more and more of an area of land
if you engage someone in conversation, you try to start a conversation with them
to give more details about something you have said or written
to give a reason for something bad happening which makes other people think that it is not so bad or that it is not your fault
if the sound or picture of a film or recording fades in, it becomes gradually louder or brighter
if the sound or picture of a film or recording fades out, it gradually becomes quieter or less clear until you cannot hear or see it
if a structure drops to the ground because it is weak or damaged
if an animal feeds on a particular type of food, it usually eats that food
to feel physically and mentally strong enough to do something
to take care of yourself without needing help from other people
to find something after searching for it
to try hard not to show an emotion, or to try hard not to let your emotions control what you do
if food fills someone up, it makes them feel as if they have eaten enough

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: flag down sth or flag sth down
phrasal_verbs.definition: to make a vehicle stop by waving at the driver

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: flush out sb/sth or flush sb/sth out
phrasal_verbs.definition: to force a person or animal to come out of the place they are hiding in
if something made of glass [e.g. windscreen, glasses] fogs up, or if something fogs it up, it becomes covered with small drops of water and you cannot see through it any more

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: freeze out sb or freeze sb out
phrasal_verbs.definition: to make someone feel that they are not part of a group by being unfriendly towards them, or to stop someone from being included in an arrangement or activity
become so afraid you cannot move or do anything
to get nearer to someone or something that you are chasing
if a law or proposal gets through, or if someone gets a law or proposal through, it is officially accepted by a government or organisation

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: get across sth or get sth across
phrasal_verbs.definition: to successfully communicate an idea to other people
to succeed in not being criticised or punished for something wrong that you have done
to succeed in not being criticised or punished for something wrong that you have done
to start again at the beginning
to start doing something seriously and with a lot of your attention and effort
to start to become involved in an activity that other people are already doing, often without being invited to

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: get in sth or get sth in
phrasal_verbs.definition: to manage to do something even though you do not have much time because you are busy doing other things
to stop nagging someone
to get started
to be elected as a member of an organisation
if news or information gets out, people hear about it even though someone is trying to keep it secret
to feel better after having an illness

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: get sth out of sth/doing sth
phrasal_verbs.definition: to enjoy something or think that something is useful

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: get sth out of your mind
phrasal_verbs.definition: to stop thinking about something

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: get to the bottom of sth
phrasal_verbs.definition: to understand something properly, not superficially
if two or more people get together, or if someone gets two or more people together, they meet in order to do something or spend time together
to do something, especially something that other people think is wrong

phrasal_verbs.phrasal_verb: give away sth or give sth away
phrasal_verbs.definition: to let someone know something that should be kept secret, often by mistake
if you give in to an emotion or desire, you stop trying not to feel it and you allow your actions to be controlled by that emotion or desire
to allow the police to catch you
to try to get something that you want [e.g. job]
to chase or follow someone in order to catch them
if something goes against a rule or something you believe in, it does not obey it or agree with it
if an illness goes around, a lot of people get it
to examine or think about something again or after it has happened
to use information or experience that you have of someone or something in order to help you decide what to do or think
to attack someone
if something goes for a particular amount of money, it is sold for that amount
if someone’s name goes forward, it is suggested that that person should compete for a position or a job
if a light or machine goes off, it stops working
to criticise someone continuously
to use a computer or the Internet, or to visit a website
to go to a particular place after going somewhere else
if your thoughts or sympathies go out to someone, you feel very sorry for them when they are in a difficult situation
to experience an unpleasant or difficult situation or event
to click on a menu, a menu item, or a particular web page
to eat very quickly
to not move forwards, usually because you are shy or afraid
to spend a lot of time in a particular place, or to spend a lot of time with someone
to dislike or disagree with someone or something for a particular reason
if a wound heals over, new skin grows over it
to put food onto a plate for yourself
to talk about a particular subject for a long time, often in a way that other people find boring
to not start, although you expect it to
to continue to defend yourself against an enemy or attack
to meet someone for a particular purpose
to move closer to other people, or to hold your arms and legs close to your body, usually because you are cold or frightened
to stop the public from finding out about something bad that has happened
to force a group of people to accept something, or to give someone a punishment (e.g. fine, ban)
to give information about someone who has done something wrong to a person in authority, especially the police
to become involved in an activity with other people
to join the army, navy, or airforce
to continue to be more advanced and successful than other people, or to make sure that someone is more advanced or successful than other people
to not eat, drink or use something that can harm you
to continue to do something (until it is finished)
to not tell someone everything you know about a situation or an event that has happened
to continue to do something, or to do something again and again
to not become involved in something
to make a child stay at school or at home, especially as a punishment
to make someone go to bed later than they usually do
to prevent someone from doing something, especially work, by spending time with them
to keep something secret
if you keep to the point, you do not write or talk about other topics
to not allow something that is at a high level to fall to a lower level
to hit someone with a vehicle and injure or kill them
to design the way in which a house, city, or garden is built or created
if a subject leads into another subject or discussion, it is the reason why you start talking about the second subject
if secret information leaks out, people who should not know this information find out about it
to not punish someone who has committed a crime or done something wrong, or to not punish someone severely
to allow a person or animal to leave somewhere, especially by opening a locked or closed door
to tell the truth about something
to relax mentally
to prepare your body muscles for a physical activity by stretching and doing simple exercises
to claim falsely that something is true; to pretend
if your eyes mist over, they become filled with tears which stop you from seeing clearly
if something made of glass [e.g. windscreen, glasses] mists up, or if something mists it up, it becomes covered with small drops of water and you cannot see through it anymore
to go to a place to deal with a difficult situation
to leave the place or area where you live and go and live in another place
to begin living in a new house or area
to move forward in one’s life and not look back to the past
to fall asleep when you do not intend to go to sleep
if an area opens off another area, you can enter one from the other directly
to hide a disagreement or difficulty and try to make people believe that there is no problem
to visit somewhere for a short time, usually while you are going somewhere else
if an event passes off in a good way, it happens in that way
to give a disease to another person or animal
to rain very heavily
to suddenly become happier or more energetic, or to make someone feel this way
to eat only a small amount of a meal because you are not hungry or because you are feeling ill
to lift something by using a bill (birds)
to stand up again after you have fallen
to enter a place or vehicle quickly and not in an organised way
to leave a place or vehicle quickly and not in an organised way
to pretend to agree with someone, or to do what someone wants for a short time, in order to get something from them or to avoid making them angry
if a piece of electrical equipment plugs into a supply of electricity or another piece of electrical equipment, it works by being connected to that supply of electricity or that piece of equipment
to catch for food
to destroy a structure because it is not wanted anymore
to drive to a different part of the road, usually a part where the vehicles are travelling faster
if the police pull someone who is driving a car over, they order them to drive the car to the side of the road and stop
to remove something from the ground
to continue travelling somewhere
